title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Building Communication Capability for a 2nd Deployable Company

description.narrative: Section 2282 Building Capacity of Foreign Security Forces programs (formerly known as Section 1206 Train and Equip), are intended to build partnership capacity for time-sensitive "new and emerging" counter-terrorist operations or to participate in or support military and stability operations in which the U.S. Armed Forces are a participant.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Special Operations Task Group Deployment

description.narrative: The objective of this program is to improve the command and control, tactical capability, and interoperability of Hungarys Special Operations Forces to conduct day and night operations in support of the ISAF mission. Equipment provided includes communications equipment, thermal imaging devices, weapons and accessories, individual protective equipment, medical supplies, C-IED equipment, and biometric equipment. The recipient unit will be the 34th Special Operations Forces Battalion.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Hungary ISR Capabilities

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

title.narrative: Inter-European Aviation Safety Program Management Mobile Course - Hungary

description.narrative: This two-week mobile version of the in-residence course was conducted at Szolnok Helicopter Base, Hungary. It is designed to provide students assigned to Flight Safety Officer (FSO) positions with a working knowledge of aviation mishap prevention. The course graduate is capable of administrating an aircraft mishap prevention program to include: Bird/wildlife aircraft strike hazard (BASH), midair collision avoidance (MACA), hazardous air traffic reports (HATRs), hazard reporting, inspections, airfield safety, Air Force Safety Automated System (AFSAS) queries, awards, disaster response, deployed safety, as well as philosophies and an understanding of the safety organizational hierarchy/philosophies. The course places Risk Management at the center of establishing a safety culture and addresses concepts, methodologies and best practices in the area of Risk Management, while providing how-to instruction in applying primary and select RM tools and techniques. IEASPM brings together aviation safety professionals from across NATO and PfP, standardizing tactics, techniques and procedures across the Alliance while building a common cadre of aviation safety professionals.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Special Operations Forces Development (2282 T2)

description.narrative: This program provides Hungarian SOF with articles and services that will enhance Hungary's operational effectiveness both in counter-ISIL operations in Iraq and in operations in support of RSM. The program requires a DTSA waiver for thermal imagers.
